project_abstract.cdata: The objectives of the Water, Sanitation and Solid Waste Urgent Works Project are to: (i) restore water, sanitation and solid waste services to the population depending on pipe water supply and water borne sewerage systems to a level that would mitigate public health risk in priority areas; (ii) develop a long term sector strategy and the details of an emergency project consistent with the strategy; (iii) rebuild and strengthen sector institutions so that the improvements will be sustainable; and (iv) prepare final designs and bidding documents for the rehabilitation project. The project consists of five parts: (a) the supply of equipment and materials, including pipe, fittings, spare parts and rolling stock for water, sewerage and solid waste disposal operating organizations to meet urgent requirements for systems operations; (b) urgent works for the provision of water supply, sanitation and solid waste services for municipalities, including rehabilitation and repair of water sources and distribution networks; (c) emergency development plan for the water management sector; (d) institutional strengthening, focusing on strategic planning and sector organization, project, financial and maintenance management, computer skills and reduction of unaccounted-for water; and (e) preparation of the water, sanitation and solid waste rehabilitation project.
